signature_matches.name: packed with UPX
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: packed with UPX
    namespace: anti-analysis/packer/upx
    authors:
      - william.ballenthin@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: file
      dynamic: file
    att&ck:
      - Defense Evasion::Obfuscated Files or Information::Software Packing [T1027.002]
    mbc:
      - Anti-Static Analysis::Software Packing::UPX [F0001.008]
    examples:
      - CD2CBA9E6313E8DF2C1273593E649682
      - Practical Malware Analysis Lab 01-02.exe_:0x0401000
  features:
    - or:
      - and:
        - format: pe
        - or:
          - section: UPX0
          - section: UPX1
      - and:
        - format: elf
        - or:
          - string: "UPX!"

signature_matches.name: stealth_network
signature_matches.description: Network activity detected but not expressed in monitor API logs
Malicious sample detected (through community Yara rule)
Sample contains only a LOAD segment without any section mappings

match_data: $Info: This file is packed with the UPX executable packer http://upx.sf.net $
$Id: UPX 3.94 Copyright (C) 1996-2017 the UPX Team. All Rights Reserved. $

signature_matches.description: Connects to IPs without corresponding DNS lookups
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Sample tries to kill multiple processes (SIGKILL)
Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports
Sample tries to kill a process (SIGKILL)
URLs found in memory or binary data
ELF contains segments with high entropy indicating compressed/encrypted content

mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.
Creates hidden files, links and/or directories
ELF contains segments with high entropy indicating compressed/encrypted content
Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports
Sample tries to kill multiple processes (SIGKILL)

T1071.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.

T1564.001.description: Creates hidden files, links and/or directories

T1027.description: ELF contains segments with high entropy indicating compressed/encrypted content

T1003.description: Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system

T1518.001.description: Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)

T1489.description: Sample tries to kill multiple processes (SIGKILL)
